author: Staff Reporter
text:
The forensic probe of a set of video clippings of the JNU event ordered by the Delhi government has found that the two videos were “manipulated” where voices of persons not present in the clips were added.

Out of the seven videos sent by the Delhi government to the Hyderabad-based Truth Labs, two have been found to be tampered with while the rest were authentic, sources said.

“In the manipulated clips, videos have been edited and voices have been added. The main report, with a supplementary, has been submitted to the Delhi government,” an official said.

‘Pamphlet authentic’

The JNU administration has claimed that the Mahishasur event pamphlets that HRD Minister Smriti Irani read out from in Parliament were “authentic”. The organisers of the event, which was held in the year 2014, however, have been maintaining that the pamphlets were “fake”.

The AAP govt had ordered magisterial inquiry into raising anti-national slogans on the JNU campus
title: Two videos ‘manipulated’
